intro: Polygonum vernale, commonly known as spring knotweed, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems that are often reddish in color. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, and it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Polygonum vernale is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and along stream banks.
